text:
Bladder bag, I presume, at Bir & Fud 23/09/16.
Golden yellow with a decent off White head.
Nose is apple orchard, straw, farmy, light pear drop.
Taste comprises bitter sweet pear, light smoke, earthy apple skin, straw, light funkdom. 
Medium bodied, moderate carbonation, drying close. 
Decent enough Perry ... not overly sweet .... balance is good.
user_location: Hazlemere, the lower Xhitlerns, Buckinghamshire, ENGLAND

text: Bag in box at jolly judge. Pours hazy golden, nose is biscuity, light pear, taste is chewy toffee, biscuit, pear.

568ml bottle. Pours a watery yellow colour, no head and aroma of woody pear, leather. Taste is sweet sugary pear with woody oaky & light barnyard notes. Smooth syrupy mouthfeel, medium bodied, low carbonation, some lingering sweetness but fairly clean finish. Quite drinkable.

Tap, London. Ripe pear on the nose, bit of kerosene and alcohol spice yet quite clean. Very pale straw in colour, small ring of white foam. Quite sweet upfront, dries out a bit, touch of acid with notes of ripe green pear skin, spice and alcohol warmth ot finish. Nice fullness about the body, relatvely high but soft carbonation. Enjoyable perry
bottle at home ... golden ... no head ... soft sweet almost sulpherur pear nose ... sweet pear ... light tananins again hint of sulpher ... little 1 dimensional but ok

Cask at Magpie & Crown, London. Pours a hazy, grapefruit pink with a faint cream. Tangy, almost sour pear nose. Flavor is medium to big sweet, fairly tangy with lots of residual, straight sugar and ripe pears. Medium bodied with fine carbonation. Sweet, sticky finish with plenty more tangy pear and heavy sugars. Its a very sweet perry, but this tangy, borderline sour edge cuts into it just barely enough to make it more palatable. This beverage is quite full of character. I like it.

Bottle 568ml. @ [ Tasting by Fin & Loz ].Clear light yellow colour with virtually no head. Aroma is moderate pear, sweet pear, fruit juice ! Flavour is moderate sweet with a average duration, thin pear. Body is medium, texture is watery to oily, carbonation is flat. [20111022]

Bottle at Fin & Lozs tasting with Jan, Charlotte, Craig, Stella & kids consumed Saturday 22.10.11 I picked this up at the Hop Pocket, Bishops Frome, Herefordshire, summer 2011   This is essentially a watered down version of a standard Gwatkin perry (in my opinion) but it is better than expected even if some of the lovely juicy fruitiness and zappiness has now sadly departed, not bad and easy drinking.  A6 A4 T6 P3 Ov12  3.1
Polypin at Moreton in . Marsh Beer Fest 11. Hazy pale straw with no head. Sweet, pearlike notes, quite floral, perfumed but it did grow on me. Ok

From a bag in a box at the Portcullis, Clifton, Bristol 11/08/2011. Amber coloured with a blushed, pinkish tinge. Slightly strange perry with plenty of sweet fruit upfront, followed by a contrasting skin and cores dryness. Interesting.
